snippet: Mr. Fischer, an obsessive tinkerer, created a wall anchor that’s used by millions and the first synchronized camera flash, an idea that came to him when trying to photograph his newborn daughter.
abstract: Artur Fischer, prolific German inventor who registered over 1,100 patents including wall anchor still used across world and synchronized camera flash, dies at age 96; received lifetime achievement award from European Patent Office in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Fischer, an obsessive tinkerer, created a wall anchor that’s used by millions and the first synchronized camera flash, an idea that came to him when trying to photograph his newborn daughter.

headline.main: Artur Fischer, Inventor With More Patents Than Edison, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: Artur Fischer, 96, a German Tinkerer With More Patents Than Edison, Is Dead
